DataElement.preferredDefinition: The category of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.

Concepts.definition: The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/22/22 jk LabCas AI, released as part of quarterly draft content review.  10/1/19 jk created for MCL LabCas PCA-Genomic pilot.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant cellular population that has increased in size and infiltrates the surrounding tissues._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.: A tumor at the original site of origin.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.
A tumor at the original site of origin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A malignant cellular population that has increased in size and infiltrates the surrounding tissues.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A malignant cellular population that has increased in size and infiltrates the surrounding tissues.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
